about_the_game:
A Combination of Melee and Shooting

Experience gruesome combat against different enemy types. Switch between a heavy-hitting pickaxe and the Wave Gun to juggle the unrelenting attacks.

An Over-Heated World

In 2075, most humans migrated to a distant planet as Earth succumbs to the effects of The Overheating. Radiation exposure then caused a disease called Gradual Hyperthermia (GH) that slowly wiped out the remaining survivors on Earth. GH caused hallucinations, unexplained rage, hyper-strength, and emanating heat. Once it reaches its ember point, the survivors, once human, will become monstrous creatures simply waiting for its demise.

Discover the Past

Play as Gravitus, an ex-soldier and now researcher tasked by Katani Industry to return to Earth. His mission is to explore the possible GH cures, but he crash lands in a desolate town. Explore the ghost town, face the mutated, monster-like heat vacuums, and find out what happened to the townspeople.

The Team

Ember Point was a capstone game made by a group of eight undergrad students at the NYU Game Center.

Contributors: Finn Connoly, Ryan Bevins, Hongke Luo, Peter Seo, Annie Dedas, Noa Kirschbaum, Draftsman79_

content_descriptors.notes:
This game features frequent combat scenarios with the main character smashing, kicking, and shooting the enemies. There are visuals of blood splashing. Some finishing moves show enemy dismemberment.

Strong language is used in the dialogue.

detailed_description:
Support

Ember Point requires the use of a GamePad controller. This game is compatible with computers operating on Windows systems. For the best experience, we recommend using headphones.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5 or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia 2060
  • Storage: 4 GB available space

short_description: Ember Point is a red-hot, combat-focused, third-person action game. Play as a disgraced defector, Gravitus, from a militaristic mega-corporation. He is stuck cleaning up the mess his former employers left behind — all while wielding a top secret “cure” for a gruesome disease.
